DialogueOption.Text: I dived into the waterways and found a Nomai mural depicting Hearthian ancestors on land.
Hey Moraine, did you hear anything about ghost matter disappearing?

Dialogue.Page: Yeah, I thought everyone knew that. Ghost matter evaporates slowly, doesn't it?
Still, it's a little scary how long it's taken that little patch in the village to evaporate..
The fact that there are Hearthian skeletons in there, tells us that little patch must have been around even when our Hearthian ancestors were learning to walk on land!
Yeah! Didn't you know? Riebeck says those must have been early Hearthians, unlucky enough to stumble upon that patch of ghost matter while exploring the surface of Timber Hearth.
Our species used to be aquatic before our ancestors learned to walk on land, you know.
Riebeck thinks our ancestors learned how to live on land because if they didn't, we'd have died instantly whenever we got launched out of the water by geysers!
But even though they could go on land, Riebeck says our ancestors mainly lived in the huge underground cave system inside the geysers.
Apparently, there's a whole interconnected underwater cave system inside the planet that our ancestors swam around in!

That part's a recent discovery, though. Nobody's even explored the waterways yet, since Riebeck "wasn't going to get eaten by an underwater monster", and the other astronauts were uh, busy, lazy, or missing.
Oh, I can't even imagine what it'd be like... Swimming around those same waterways our ancestors lived in for millennia!
I'd love to jump down a geyser and explore the waterways myself - but Mayor Rutile says I'll drown, since we can't breathe underwater like early Hearthians did, and I'm bad at holding my breath..
Hey, um.. The traveler's spacesuit lets you breathe in space, right? Do you think it'd let you breathe underwater too, astronaut?
I'd hate for you to get your spacesuit wet before your launch, but.. Could you jump down a geyser and explore the waterways inside Timber Hearth in my place?

DialogueOption.Text: That sounds fun! I'll give it a go sometime.
I swam around the waterways already! I found a Nomai mural of our Hearthian ancestors down there.

Dialogue.Page: Really? You're the best, astronaut!
If you do find anything down there, I wanna hear all about it, okay?
Oooh, it's like revisiting the place where our ancestors came from! This is gonna be an incredible day for Hearthian history, astronaut!
Woah.. What? A Nomai mural of.. our ancestors on land? That’s awesome!
It’s not a huge underwater monster like I was hoping.. But it’s still really awesome!
But wait... <Pause> Doesn’t that mean Hearthians must have already existed when the Nomai were around?
And it sounds like we were still able to live on both water AND land back then!
Aw, when did Hearthians stop being able to breathe underwater completely then? If we were still able to breathe underwater nowadays, I'd be able to swim around the waterways all day..
But wow.. Isn't this discovery gonna totally upend our knowledge of Hearthian history?
I think you’d better fly to Brittle Hollow as soon as you can to tell Riebeck about this huge discovery, astronaut! They'll probably lose their marbles revising the Hearthian history books.
Don’t forget, you can use your signalscope to track down the other travelers more easily!
